source_sentence: 波斯教殘經(敦煌莫高窟藏本今歸京師圖書館　佚籍叢殘十五)(殘寫經一卷前半已缺佚後半完好然無後題吾友臨川李君證剛翊灼以其中專闡明明暗之旨證以景教三威蒙度讚有合處遂定為景教經典然考大祆摩尼與景教頗類似未易分別且皆由波斯流入中土故姑顏之曰波斯教經以俟當世之宗教學者考證焉宣統三年三月上虞羅振玉記)。
translation: Persian Teaching Residual Sutra (Dunhuang Mogao Cave Canon now in the Beijing Shi Library, An unknown collection of fifteen residual books) (The first half of the residual sutra is missing and the second half is intact, but there is no postscript.) My friend Linchuan Li confirmed that Gang Yizhao's exposition of the doctrine of light and darkness was based on the Jingjiao sanwei mengdu zan, so he decided that it was a Jingjiao scripture.

source_sentence: 四者不奪徒眾經論弟子。
translation: Fourth, he doesn't rob his disciples of the sūtras and treatises.

source_sentence: 隨所至方清淨住處歡喜住止。
translation: He stays joyfully in pure dwelling places wherever he goes.
They don't choose flowers or finery.
Five, he always enjoys teaching repentance.
All the people.
He's skillful, wise, and supportive.
He causes them to cultivate the path.
"The eleven things that unify the mind are of the same level.

source_sentence: 若有清淨電那勿等內懷齊心性者。
translation: "If there's a pure dānâbhī who internally harbors the nature of a unified mind.
You should know that this teacher has five experiences.

source_sentence: 一者法主慕闍拂多誕等所教智惠。
translation: One, the Dharma lord Muja Vetanta and others are taught by wisdom and intelligence.
He skillfully conducts himself with skillful manners and conducts himself with dignity.
He relies on each one's conduct and doesn't dare to change it.
He doesn't focus on his own views.
Two, he always enjoys togetherness.
He dwells with the others.
They don't want to live separately.
Each has a different plan.
Third, they are united in mind and harmony.
Because they are united, the gifts they receive are made with mutual success and virtue.
The alms that they receive are shared in the success of virtue.

source_sentence: 四者常得聽者恭敬供養。
translation: Four, they always obtain the respect and offerings of those who hear them.
They are fond of and praise him.

source_sentence: 五者常樂遠離調悔戲笑。
translation: Five, they're always happy to avoid harassing, teasing, and ridiculing.
and arguments.
He well protects internal and external [views].
They harmonize the two natures.
"Twelve internal and external [natures] are both clear.

source_sentence: 若有清淨電那勿等內懷俱明性者。
translation: "If there's a person who has the innate luminosity of pure dhāraṇī and so forth, then he should know that this teacher has five tests of discernment.
You should know that this teacher has five experiences.
One is that he well removes defilement from his mind.
He won't allow craving.
He causes his own luminous nature to always attain mastery.
He can conceptualize women as nominal.
He won't be embarrassed by forms.
He's like a bird that's high and not martyred in a net.

source_sentence: 二者不與聽者偏交厚重。
translation: Second, he doesn't associate with listeners in a partial way or in a heavy way.
Nor does he cling to the homes of those who hear him.
He treats them as if they were his own house.

source_sentence: 若見法外俗家損失及愁惱事。
translation: If he sees losses and sorrowful situations in secular homes outside the Dharma, his mind isn't sad.
They won't be sad at heart.
Suppose he gains benefits and rejoices in something.
That's also how his mind is.
Three, if he walks or stands, if he sits or lies down, his mind will be the same.
Whether sitting or lying down, he doesn't pamper the physical body or seek fine, smooth clothing, bedding, and food.

source_sentence: 不寵肉身求諸細滑衣服臥具飲食場藥鳥馬車乘以榮其身。
translation: They don't covet the physical body and seek fine, smooth clothing, bedding, food, medicine, birds, horses, and carriages to glorify it.

source_sentence: 四者常念命終險難苦楚危厄之日。
translation: Fourth, he's always mindful of the day when his life ends in danger, hardship, pain, and distress.
He'll always observe impermanence and the King of Equality.
He confronts them as he is now.
There's no time to let go of them for a moment.
Fifth, he's himself gentle and docile.
He doesn't trouble his brothers and friends.
They won't cause anger.
Nor does he expect to realize it.
They cause others to have bad reputations.
He's always able to concentrate his mind.
He always abides in the pure Dharma.
Such a person is called a jeweled tree of twelve luminous kings.
They're called the twelve jeweled trees of the luminous kings.
I've come from the world of eternal bliss.
For all of you.
I've carried it up to this point.

source_sentence: 欲以此樹栽於汝等清淨眾中。
translation: I want to plant this tree among you pure people.
You men and women of superior characteristics and good wisdom.

source_sentence: 當須各自於清淨心栽植此樹。
translation: You must each plant this tree in a pure mind.
They will cause it to grow.
It's like the best, sandless, marsh land.
They plant one and reap ten thousand.
They will continue in this way.
It reaches measureless proportions.
Now, you guys.

source_sentence: 若欲成就無上大明清淨果者。
translation: If you want to achieve the unsurpassed fruit of great clarity and purity.
You must all adorn such a jeweled tree.
Make it complete.
Why is that?
You good sons.

source_sentence: 依此樹菓得離四難及諸有身。
translation: Relying on this fruit of the tree, you'll be freed from the four difficulties and the bodies of sentient beings.
They'll escape birth and death.
They'll ultimately attain permanent victory.
They'll reach a place of well-being.
At that point, there were many muñjis and others in that time.
Hearing and teaching this sūtra, they rejoiced and roused.
They rejoiced and jumped for joy.
They praised it as unprecedented.
"The gods are good spirits.
They were unhindered and unimpeded.
And the kings of the countries.
Ministers, soldiers, and women.
The four groups of people.
They are countless and limitless.
After hearing this sūtra, they were all greatly elated.
They were all greatly elated.
They can all give rise to the mind of the unsurpassed path.
They're like plants and trees that meet with sunny spring.

source_sentence: 無不滋茂敷花結菓得成熟。
translation: They invariably flourish, producing flowers and fruits that ripen.
Only rotten roots can't flourish.
It was then that Muja and the others.
They paid homage to the messenger of knowledge.
They knelt down and saluted him with their palms together.
They said.
"Only a great sage exists.
He's the only one in the three realms who's revered.
He's the compassionate parent of all sentient beings.
He's also the great guiding teacher of the three realms.
He's also the great medical director who contains the spirits of all living beings.
He's also the Wonderful Emptiness that accommodates all forms.
He's also a higher heaven that encompasses them all.
He's also the true ground that produces true results.
He's also the ocean of sweet nectar for sentient beings.
He's also a vast mountain of jeweled incense.
It's also a pillar of adamantine jewels that allows multitudes to exist.
He's also the shipmaster of the giant ocean of skillful wisdom.
He's also a compassionate savior in a fire pit.
He's also the one who takes on eternal life in death.
He's also the clarity and neutrality of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 亦是三界諸牢固獄解脫明門諸慕闍等。
translation: They're also the muñjas who are the gate of knowledge of the liberation of the three realms and solid hells.
He also enlightened the messengers of insight.
He said.
'Only the single great luminous honored one can praise the noble qualities.

source_sentence: 非是我等肉舌劣智稱讚如來功德智惠。
translation: It's not we with our weak physical tongues and poor intelligence who praise the Tathāgata's merits and wisdom.
We can understand a small part of it out of a thousand million parts.
Now, I'll encourage my own small virtue and small wisdom.
I'd like to praise the noble one for his vast compassion with a small amount of thought.
Please let the great sage.
Have compassion on him.

source_sentence: 除捨我等曠劫已來無明重罪。
translation: Remove and relinquish the heavy sins of ignorance that we've had for ages.
Let's make sure that they are extinguished.
Now, we dare not despise it.
We must all consecrate the unsurpassed precious tree.
Make it the perfect condition for this teaching.
The water will cleanse us of the heavy defilements of dust.
It will cause our luminous natures to be always purified.
Conditioned on this Dharma medicine and great dhāraṇī, the spell will cure us of the heavy defilements of many eons.
The spell will cure our serious illnesses for many eons.
They'll all be healed.
Because of this wisdom, we'll be firmly restrained.
We'll be tethered to it.
Against their enemies, we'll all become strong.
We'll all become strong and victorious.
It's because of this subtle crown of many characteristics.
We're adorned.
We'll all attain their fulfillment.
Conditioned on this radiant pattern of our original nature.
It seals [he*(thing/worm)] us as a species.
We won't lose it.
Conditioned on this sweet meal with its hundred flavors, we'll eat and drink.
It fills us up.
They'll free us from hunger and thirst.
Take this countless varieties of exquisite music as cause.
It entertains us.
We're free of grief and anxiety.
It's because of these various exotic treasures.
Give them to us.
They'll make us prosperous.
By virtue of this net of wisdom.
It scoops us up in the ocean and carries us across.
They placed their precious boats.
Now, we've been blessed with superior characteristics.
We've been able to see the extraordinary features of a great sage.
We've also heard such a subtle approach to the Dharma.
It frees us from the defilements of our afflictions.
We've attained mental enlightenment.
We accept the Tathāgata's pearl.

source_sentence: 威光得履缶道過去諸聖不可稱數。
translation: Their aura is so radiant that they can follow the path of the profound sages of the past, who are incalculable.

source_sentence: 皆依此門得離四難及諸有身。
translation: They all relied on this approach to escape the four difficulties and the bodies of sentient beings.
They reached the realm of light.
They experienced measureless happiness.

source_sentence: 唯願未來一切明性得遇如是光明門者。
translation: May it be the case that in the future all luminous natures will encounter such a gate of radiance.
If they see and hear it, they'll be like the sages of yore and me today.
They'll be like the sages of yore and like me today.
They rejoice when they hear the teaching.
Their minds are enlightened, and they honor and accept it.
They will respect and accept it.
They don't have doubts.
It was then that the masses heard this sūtra.
After hearing this sūtra.
They believed and accepted it according to the teaching.
They joyfully approved and handed it down.
